div.p: The Ever-changing Labyrinth A Large-Scale Analysis of Wildcard DNS
Powered Blackhat SEO Kun Du1, Hao Yang1, Zhou Li, Haixin Duan1, Kehuan Zhang2
Search Engine Op.miza.on(SEO) Whitehat SEO, to promote a site or keywords
sitemap, descriptive keywords in title or metadata Encouraged by SEs
Blackhat SEO manipulates SE to gain quicker and higher visibility Keywords stuffing, link farming, forum spamming, SE
cloaking, Traditional tricks are punished by SEs
How does Spider Pool work? Bypass loop detection of SE
Countless web sites with wildcard DNS Defeat content plagiarism checker
Ever-changing, dynamic content Free riding of reputable website
Without spamming or compromising Long tail keywords
Less competition Spiders/Crawlers trapped in ever-changing labyrinth
A week later, ~15 thousand visits to our site from SE through Spider Pool
Promo.on Effect: indexed by google Our website was indexed by Google and Baidu
Many sites include our URLs prompted
Many websites have links we prompted.
The subdomains looked like random string. We verified they have wildcard DNS enabled
Ever-changing content: appearance First visit Second visit Almost same appearance, only different titles
Ever-changing content: view-source First visit Second visit The hyperlinks changed completely
Free riding of reputable sites: Amazon
Where to buy hallucinogenQQ:-/ 0 results. You may also like
The spider is trapped in the labyrinth
The crawler follows the link, fed with the keywords prompted.
Even if the spider goes back to the domain it visited before, it still thinks this site is new one.
Ever-newer content flow on spiders who step into the same sites
Exit: customer web site/site for free riding
We sampled 1,000 and verified manually, False Positive ~0.8%
cn xyz pw com win cc top wang party science
PW: ccTLD (Country Code TLD) for Republic of Palau
In 2013, Symantec claimed .PW was a significant source of spam e-mail
Top 10 registrar accounts for 81% SEO domains
Most in China China has strict policies on
The business is quite centralized, Chinese
Where are the web servers hosted?
Top 10 ASNs hosting SEO domains (All in US)
Register domains in China, but host servers in the U.S. Why?
21 independent spider pools 15,816 SEO Domain 1,453 customer domains 7,236,315 promoted URLs
More than half of their customers are illegal in China
Search in Google and Baidu, in the first page
How to buy air gun in Hainan Sanya city
How to buy fake invoice in Yueyang city
Top 20 reputable sites abused by spider pools and URL pabern
Passive detection: Check features of Spider
Spider Pool Domains Detec.on in Baidu
Summary We infiltrated a new type of Blackhat SEO and and
get the features of its infrastructure. Together with Baidu, we detected ~1.4M spider pool To SEs: be aware of this new threat and purify
search result, To reputable sites: not be abused for free riding Useful information to attack cyber crimes, e.g. QQ#
